press_reference_link.label: Avaada Group Appoints Kishor Nair as CEO for its Renewable Arm Avaada Energy

news_insight_text_link.news_insight_description: Avaada Energy has secured a 1050MW contract in a government tender and achieved a significant refinancing of INR 4471 crore ($535 million) for its solar projects in Rajasthan. Additionally, the company obtained a 21-year project loan facility from AIFL and a Rs 1190 crore loan from the State Bank of India for a 400 MWp solar PV project in Gujarat.

overview_description.description: Avaada is a renewable energy company that develops and operates solar and wind power projects. Their unique strategy interweaves business goals with environmental sustainability and social responsibility, producing mutually beneficial results. By contributing to the community’s socio-economic development in the short term, they foresee the delivery of continual value to their shareholders. Through their community engagement initiatives, they are contributing to uplift the lifestyle of the communities they work with.

properties.growth_insight_description: Avaada Energy secured a 1050 MWp solar project in an NTPC auction, bringing its total portfolio in India to over 15 GWp. The company also closed INR 315 Cr financing for a captive solar project in Karnataka. Additionally, Avaada won a 250 MW solar-wind hybrid power project.

product.name: Pumped Hydro Storage
product.description: A technology using interconnected reservoirs at different elevations to store and release water for energy production, addressing the need for scalable and reliable energy storage.
